title: Need guidance: How to build practical skills for good placement by 3rd/4th year (CSE, Sem 4, GPA 8.28)
content:
Hey everyone,  
I‚Äôm currently in 2nd year, 4th sem (CSE) with a GPA around 8.28. I‚Äôve realized that just going by the book might not be enough if I want to land a good placement, and not just settle for some average or below-average package.

So I wanted to ask‚Äî**practically**, what all should I learn and do over the next one year to build solid practical skills and projects? What helped you personally in getting placed well, or what would you recommend to someone in my position?

I really want to make the most of this time before placements start in 3rd/4th year. Any advice, roadmaps, resources, or personal experiences would be appreciated!

Almost all companies paying 20+LPA has the first round of screening as DSA. The only exception that comes to mind is couchbase which shortlisted based on resume/ projects/ GitHub
There's a detailed FAQ on how to prepare for placements and build your profile. Go through it. You'll find even more comments made by me if you search this sub with relevant keywords.
